710352f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue, east side, at 27th Street.
June 28, 1928.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710353f-b.text:
Ninth Avenue, from W. 27th to 28th Streets, as viewed across the easterly portion of Chelsea Park from the roof of No. 424 W. 27th Street. The P. E. Church of the Holy Apostles
is at the S. E. corner of 28th Street.
March 24, 1929
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

710350f-b.text:
(1)
Ninth Avenue, Westside looking north from North east corner of 27th Street. Large building at the North West corner of 29th Street is the Parcel Post ofTice under construction in 1932.
Shows also a corner of the Chelsea Park.
(2)
Same.

718671f-a.text:
Chelsea Park, looking towards Ninth Avenue from the 27th Street side. The Protestant Epiecopal Church of the Holy Apostles stands on the S.E. corner of Ninth Avenue and 28th Street.
July 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

718669f-a.text:
Chelsea Park : A set of 3 views, northeastward from various points on West 27th Street between Ninth ard Tenth Avenues, showing the rear of Public School No. 33 and a Public Health Station, both located in the easterly haif of this park. Across same appears the tovn of the Empire State Bldg. and the spire of the P.E. Church of the Holy Apostles; the latter is located at the S.E. corner of Ninth Avenue and W. 28th street and has a very interesting history, being representative of a single individual's tenacity of purpose and the
reward thereof.
IR 1937 the Board of Education proposed to erect a new school here to replace that one shown, but decided not to. Note the 1 story
free milk station seen in the foreground.
August 4, 1938.
Vies 1,2 and 3.
P. 1. Sperr

711869f-a.text:

1558086.title: 303 Ninth Avenue - West 27th Street
1558086.folder: 303 Ninth Avenue - West 27th Street, Manhattan, NY

710351f-a.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, north from W. 27th Street, showing the easterly side of Chelsea Park, the Public Bath (at No. 407-13 W. 28th Street), the new steel structure of the Post Office's Parcel Post Office and the Ninth Avenue "El." The park occupies the entire block between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, extending from 27th to 28th
Streets.
View 2 shows only the area between W. 28th and 30th Streets of which the second block is entirely occupied by the rising
Post Office building.
May 15, 1932
View: 1-2
P. L. Sperr

710351f-b.text:
Ninth Avenue, west side, north from W. 27th Street, showing the easterly side of Chelsea Park, the Public Bath (at No. 407-13 W. 28th Street), the new steel structure of the Post Office's Parcel Post Office and the Ninth Avenue "El." The park occupies the entire block between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, extending from 27th to 28th

May 15, 1932
View: 1-2
